summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Verizon Communications on August 13, 2019, demanding telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward. It includes a cover sheet, the subpoena, a records request rider, a declaration of custodian of records form, and a non-disclosure request letter. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal statutes including conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying non-disclosure request letter to Verizon Communications.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The AUSA is the point of contact for compliance with the subpoena and is referenced in the subpoena body and the records declaration form. The name is not specified in the provided text.

connections.description: Berman, as the United States Attorney, is the supervisor of the Assistant United States Attorney who is handling the subpoena and investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Verizon
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues a grand jury subpoena to Verizon Communications demanding telephone records for an investigation into suspected felony violations.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Verizon to appear before the grand jury on this date, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced by the deadline.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (Grand Jury location)
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks extensive telephone records from Verizon for specific numbers covering the period from July 6, 2019, onward, indicating an active investigation at that time.
The investigation involves suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records in federal investigations).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested Verizon to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the grand jury investigation.
The document is dated August 13, 2019, which is after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and before his death on August 10, 2019, suggesting the investigation was ongoing post-arrest.
The subpoena is issued under the authority of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, who was overseeing the Epstein case in the Southern District of New York.
